document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 56–61. Palpada chilena (Rondani, 1863): (56) male visiting a Lantara camara L., Santiago (photo by Orlando Montes); (57) female resting in a leave, Pucón (Photo by Miguel Mellado). Palpada elegans (Blanchard, 1852): (58) female visiting a Trifolium sp., Santiago (photo by Matías Cortés); (59) male visiting an Asteraceae, Lago Lanalhue (photo by Edgardo Flores). Palpada meigenii (Wiedemann, 1830): (60) males visiting Foeniculum vulgare Mill., Biobío river (photo by Orlando Montes); (61) female resting, Puerto Montt (photo by Matías Cortés).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 56–61 .
Palpada chilena ( Rondani, 1863 )
: (56) male visiting a
Lantara camara
L., Santiago (photo by Orlando Montes); (57) female resting in a leave, Pucón (Photo by Miguel Mellado).
Palpada elegans ( Blanchard, 1852 )
: (58) female visiting a
Trifolium
sp., Santiago (photo by Matías Cortés); (59) male visiting an Asteraceae, Lago Lanalhue (photo by Edgardo Flores).
Palpada meigenii ( Wiedemann, 1830 )
: (60) males visiting
Foeniculum vulgare Mill.
, Biobío river (photo by Orlando Montes); (61) female resting, Puerto Montt (photo by Matías Cortés).

subSubSection.paragraph: World distribution. Argentina , Uruguay and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Coquimbo to Los Lagos region ( Fig. 65 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (5– 2,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Palpada meigenii
has been confused many times with
Eristalis distinguendus
, currently recognized as
Palpada distinguenda ( Wiedemann, 1830 )
. In fact, Porter in different papers (1921, 1923, 1924) recorded
P. distinguenda
from Chile and Etcheverry (1963) included it in his catalog. However, Lagrange (1990b) excludes
P. distinguenda
from Chile and mentions that it was confused with
P. meigenii
. Porter (1921) recorded
P. meigenii
visiting flowers of
Aristolochia chilensis Bridges ex Lindl
based on specimens collected by professor Stuardo in La Serena.
Neira et al. (1997)
recorded it visiting flowers of
R. iaedus .
It has also been observed visiting
Raphanus raphanistrum
L. (Ricardo Huenuanca, CSP record),
Tagetes patula
L. (Tabatha Carrera, CSP record) and
Verbena litoralis Kunth
(Orlando Montes, CSP record).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 231,068 km 2 ; AOO = 116 km 2 , 23 subpopulations and 26 localities.
